page.title: 17Caversham & Sonning Churches
page.content: There are several Anglican churches in Caversham. At St John's in Lower Caversham the services are at 8.00 a.m. for Holy Communion, 9.15 a.m. for the family service and there is the children's service at 11 a.m. Caversham Park church holds its services at Caversham Park primary school. It has one service at 11.00 a.m. There is a Methodist church in Gosbrook Road. In Sonning there is St. Andrew's church which is Church of England. Sonning church has existed in Sonning since the 9th or 10th century. The present church was probably built before A.D 1180. The church stands very near to the river and the surrounding village is beautiful.The oldest part of the church now is probably the doorway. The church is built of flint and has a square tower.
